Lash Services

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

About Lash Service

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

  Lucia Lash/Brow was born in New York City in 2015 as a salon specializing in eyelashes. I wanted to create a salon that will introduce clients to a unique eyelash extension technique that can only be experienced at Lucia Lash.  

Customers always commented on how long their lashes last after coming to Lucia Lash compared to other lash salons. Because we are always looking to improve our skills, we have used this to create a WATER PROOF eyelash extension application technique that can only be done at Lucia Lash.

We have also created a lash glue containing keratin that will help keep natural lashes healthy, while wearing lash extensions. As a result, our brand has become very popular and have reached clients all over the world.

We have worked with celebrities and Victoria Secret models prepping for the VS Fashion Show. 

In addition, we have trained more than 800 salon owners annually and globally.  

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”60px”][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”60px”][vc_column_text]

Plump Lash Lift and Tint

( Japanese Keratin Lash Lift)

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Both treatments are used to make the lashes longer and fuller, however, they work differently.  

Eyelash extensions involve the bonding of individual lashes to your natural lashes with the help of an adhesive to make them look physically fuller and longer. 

 

A Lash lift involves the natural curling and perming of your lashes to make them look longer and fuller.  

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Keratin lash Lift  STEP BY STEP:

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Read all Instructions if you don’t know anything about Keratin lash Lift.

Less chemical and more curl!
@plumplashlift gives you the best result! 

less chemical ◎
less damaged ◎

 

It lasts up to 8 Weeks!!!!!!

We use Thio-Free Japanese perming lotion. Which Is less damaging than “Traditional Keratine Lash Lift.”

Traditional ”Keratin Lash Lift” vs Plump
Lash Lift ( Japanese Keratin Lash Lift )

Our Keratin Lash Lift is the beauty equivalent of a lip injection for your lashes —the treatment instantly gives them, thickness, lift, separation, and extra definition without the use of extensions or any harmful chemicals.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Step 1：Choosing the correct rod size is the most important step in the lash lift procedure

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”5/6″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

We use about 30 kinds of rods.

 

To obtain the perfect curl, your technician should know which lash rod creates your desired curl. We have the knowledge of choosing the best rod! Ask us anything about lift designs.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 2 ：Apply Lash Lift Lotion

 

Lucia Lash/Brow Uses

less chemical ◎
less damaged ◎

We use Thio-Free Japanese perming lotion. Which Is less damaging than Regular Perming Lotion!

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”5/6″][vc_column_text]

Traditionally, the most commonly-used ingredient in perming is thioglycolic acid (often referred to as Thio). Thio is actually a salt and is the reducing agent responsible for breaking the disulfide bonds in your hair. Thio works great but one of the main issues is that it has a very unpleasant odor (If you ever had a perm I’m sure you remember the bad smell!). Also, because of the very nature of perms, Thio is damaging.

– Thio Free Perming apply   to lashes at a time. Take care to keep solution to hair area only. Cover brows with cling wrap to ensure the hairs are fixed in an upright position.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 3：Apply Keratin Treatment

 

Keratin is a protective that’s found in many beauty products thanks to its natural strengthening properties that can help enhance the health of your hair, skin, and nails. 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”5/6″][vc_column_text]

By applying the keratin solution to your eyelashes you can get a longer-lasting result when your lashes are lifted and curled beautifully.

Step 3 After leaving Step 2 on for your desired time, remove cling wrap then remove all the solution in an upwards motion using a cotton tip, leaving no residue. Once clean, apply you can get lash tinting with pure black tint.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

STEP4：Done !!

 

It lasts up to 8 weeks!!

Our lash lift gives you better retention than other lash lifts!!

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Lash Extension

 

Most salons are only concerned about the outcome of the lash service, what they look like and how long they will last. At Lucia Lash we not only want to give you fabulous lashes, but we also want to keep your natural lashes strong and healthy by using our Keratin Lash Glue. Healthy natural lashes mean longer extension retention. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”60px”][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Classic Lash Extension

 

It is an eyelash technique that is carefully applied one by one. 

I want to make my eyelashes look more natural, and I don’t want to see them even with makeup. 

It will be a recommended eyelash for such people.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”100px”][vc_column_text]

Hybrid Lash Extension 

  

This is an eyelash technique that is said to be a miracle match , and uses the latest technique to identify the customer’s hair, carefully attaches soft hair like natural hair, and doubles even those with few eyelashes. A special eyelash that looks like it has tripled.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”130px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Volume Lash Extension

 

Eyelashes for special occasions such as parties lush extension that looks dark as if you are wearing false eyelashes,

but is so natural that you do not know if you are wearing false eyelashes.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Plump Lash Lift (Japanese Keratin Lash Lift)

  

Plump Lash Lift, a lash lift that made a big break in the world. It uses a hair-friendly cosmetics-registered lift agent to replenish the inside of the hair with “hydrolyzed keratin,” which supplements the keratin protein, so it looks thicker and thicker than the natural eyelashes, and looks like it is bulging.

From such a finish, the name “Plump Lash Lift” was given. The curl is 1.5 times longer than other rush lifts, and it won’t drip even if you sweat or get wet.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”40px”][vc_empty_space height=”40px”][vc_column_text]

 Lash Extension VS Lash Lift 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”40px”][vc_empty_space height=”40px”][vc_column_text]

 After thoroughly counseling the condition, taste, and lifestyle of each customer’s eyelashes, we will propose a design, so we will respond to each customer so that there is no discrepancy that is different from imagination or does not suit you. Please rest assured. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”40px”][vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”60px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”60px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”60px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”60px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”60px”][vc_column_text]

Lucia Eyelash Extension Aftercare

 

To care for your lashes, be sure to follow these general guidelines

 

In the first 24 hours after getting your lashes done:

・Avoid having hot showers or baths, as the steam can breakdown your lash adhesive

・Avoid wearing eye makeup after your appointment

Ongoing care tips:

・Keep lashes clean and free of dust and debris

・Avoid oil-based skincare products, cleansers, and makeup removers as they cause the glue to breakdown faster – use only oil-free products

・Avoid oil-based eye makeup, particularly eyeliner. When removing eyeliner, use a cotton swab with oil-free makeup remover

・Use care when applying eye makeup

・Avoid applying additional mascara over your lash extensions, as this puts you at risk of losing lashes sooner than normal. Apply mascara will also clump the lashes together

・Do not use an eyelash curler

・Take additional care when washing your eye area; we recommend avoiding rubbing your eyes, and instead, use cotton pads or swabs to gently remove your makeup

・Avoid putting your face directly into the shower stream; the water pressure may result in damage to your lashes

・Sleep on your side or back and wear an eye mask with eye cavities to avoid pressing your lashes into the pillow

・Brush out your lashes with a mascara wand (provided by your lash technician) at least once a day in the morning, especially after getting them wet. Do this carefully without tugging your lashes

・Keep lashes away from direct heat such as ovens and blow dryers as they can cause your lash extensions to sizzle on the ends

Lash Fills and Removal

・If you come in for a fill please note that if more than 40% of the lashes are gone it will be considered a full set

・Lash Fill should be done every 2-4 weeks depending on which style of lashes you have and the retention you keep

・The average person loses about 5 lashes per day naturally during a normal lash cycle so do not be alarmed as this is normal

・Please come in for removals, do not attempt to remove your lashes at home. It is a quick and painless procedure when done professionally and keep the integrity of your natural lashes.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”100px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”100px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” gap=”30″ kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top” css=”.vc_custom_1616020774488{border-bottom-width: 1px !important;border-bottom-color: #e7e7e7 !important;border-bottom-style: solid !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]

Brow Services

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

All About Brow Lamination

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

What is Brow Lamination?

Brow Lamination works in a similar way as a lash lift. It is a semi-permanent eyebrow trend that essentially involves straightening the brow hairs so that they all stand in the desired direction.

 

How long will it last?

Brow lamination is perfect for individuals who have a relatively good amount of brow hair and wants to enhance their brows to give an illusion of thicker, symmetrical, and uniformed brows that last up to 6 to 8 weeks.

​

Can you put makeup on laminated brows?

As with any perm, the most important thing to do post-lamination is to keep your brows away from water, steam and makeup for at least 24 hours.

 

 

How often can I have a Brow Lamination?

You can repeat the treatment after a minimum of 4 to 6 weeks or until your brow hair grows back into its natural state.

 

Pre-Treatment Procedures​

Arrive at your appointment with eyebrow makeup-free. This includes a brow pencil or powder, concealer, and foundation.

Shower prior to your appointment as you will be advised not to wet your brows for 24 hours to ensure the solution properly sets.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

BROW LAMINATION STEP BY STEP:

 

Read all Instructions if you don’t know anything about brow lamination.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Lucia Lash/Brow Uses

less chemical ◎

less damaged ◎

 

We use Thio-Free Japanese perming lotion.

Which is less damaging than Regular Perming Lotion!

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

STEP 1： Thio Free Perming apply to one brow at a time. Take care to keep solution to hair area only. Cover brows with cling wrap to ensure the hairs are fixed in an upright position.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”5/6″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

STEP 2： After leaving Step 1 on for your desired time, remove the cling wrap and then by using a dry cotton tip, remove all the solution in an upwards motion leaving no residue. Brow Keratin Nourish to both brows.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/6″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

STEP 3：After leaving Step 2 on for your desired time, remove cling wrap then remove all the solution in an upwards motion using a cotton tip, leaving no residue. Once clean, apply you can get brow tinting and cleaning your brow.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

STEP 4： After waiting the desired time, remove all the solution then apply Step 3 – Brow Keratin Nourish to both brows.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”60px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”100px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”60px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Microblading VS Brow Lamination

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Microblading is a more invasive and permanent eyebrow transformation that one might invest in for a brow look that will last for about 1-2 years. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

I want to get my eyebrows microbladed

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”80px”][vc_column_text]

Brow Lamination is more of a quick and temporary (6-8 weeks) perming treatment that might be a more affordable solution to achieve the brow look you’re going for.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

BROW LAMINATION

 

Eyebrow Lamination is a relatively new procedure that focuses on creating shiny, smooth brows. Brow lamination is a microblading alternative that fills in gaps in brows and gives them the fill of fullness and growth in a fast, noninvasive way. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

EYE BROW TINT

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Regular Tint 

 

Lash tinting is a service that can take 10-15 minutes depending on the color you are trying to achieve. They are colored from root to tip, giving them a darker, fuller and more enhanced/ dramatic appearance. Tints can last from 2-3 weeks. 

 

Regular Tint      $30

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

Henna Tint

 

Natural coloring components with organic compounds used to accelerate the process of dyeing eyebrows.  We have a wide range of shade pallets that will allow to choose the perfect shade for coloring any eyebrows. 

 

Henna Tint         $40

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”60px”][vc_images_carousel images=”9655,9720,9721,9722,9723,9724,9725,9726″ img_size=”large” slides_per_view=”5″][vc_empty_space height=”60px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”60px”][vc_column_text]

Post-Treatment Procedures

 

・Avoid getting your brows wet for 24 hours after application. This means no saunas, swimming, or heavy exercising that can cause excess sweating.

・Do not apply brow makeup or self-tanning on the face for at least 24 hours after your treatment.​

・Gently comb brow hairs back into place daily.​

・Avoid oil-based products and cream around your brows.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”100px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”100px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”100px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width=”stretch_row” gap=”30″ kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top” css=”.vc_custom_1616020774488{border-bottom-width: 1px !important;border-bottom-color: #e7e7e7 !important;border-bottom-style: solid !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_column_text]

Permanent Makeup Services

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

What causes sparse brows?

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

When you look in the mirror, you may notice that your eyebrows are not as full as they used to be. Less hair in the eyebrow area is disappointing to women and men alike. An ironic fact is that many women spend a great deal of time plucking, waxing or threading their eyebrows when they are young, only to bemoan the fact that their eyebrows are sparse when they are older.

There are many reasons that we experience hair loss of the eyebrows. Some factors that contribute to brows that are less than full include:

・Hormonal changes
・Genetics
・Years of overplucking and removal
・Nutritional deficiencies
・Normal aging of hair follicles

Using cosmetics such as eyebrow gel, pencil, or powder is one way to correct this problem. However, this is not a foolproof method, since it can be difficult to select the right color to match and look natural.

It can also be frustrating because it often takes a lot of time to fill in the brows while making sure that both sides are even. Luckily, Lucia Lash/Brow has a permanent solution that is available for this common beauty problem.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

EYEBROW(MCROBLADING) 

  

Microblading is a semi-permanent tattoo technique used to create the illusion of fuller brows. We draw each hair stroke one by one to create a very real looking eyebrow. You can have perfectly fluffy brows that look natural with Microblading service. Microblading is ideal for someone who has experienced some hair loss and wants to achieve very natural looking eyebrows. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

What is Microblading?

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

A different method of achieving the look of fuller eyebrows is through a technique called powdered brows. Powdered brows, sometimes known as ombre brows or microblading, utilize a somewhat similar procedure to microblading but have some additional advantages. Many people prefer this method due to its soft and natural look and less invasive nature.

With powdered brows, instead of merely using strokes to fill in eyebrow hairs, the needle is used to draw both dashes and dots on the targeted area. The pigment is deposited onto the skin, which causes it to last longer than the ?scratches? of microblading.

The methodology of ombre brows utilizes a technique of ?shaded? brows to give the appearance of fullness, thus giving excellent definition. You can build upon the initial shading to layer the look of your eyebrows. At first, the brows may seem dark, but they quickly fade to a soft, gentle look.

When given the option of microblading vs. powdered brows, many people choose the powdered brows for aesthetic purposes. Sometimes, a person may want to have a more solid look for her brow, and by getting powdered brows, you can enjoy looking in a mirror and seeing a complete brow.

Other times, a person may want more density in a certain shade. Using the technique of powdered brows, you can get exactly what you want. Other people choose this method because it is less invasive and therefore, does not cause as much pain. And, this semi-permanent technique is the suggested and preferred method for those people who have oily skin, since this skin type does not hold the pigment of microblading very well. More mature skin types also respond better to this brow-filling method due to their loss of collagen.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]

Less collagen means the skin is thinner, which means that the microblading technique feels more painful and invasive than when you get ombre brows.

When you get powdered brows, you should return for a touch-up procedure two months after the original procedure. After that, the brows should last between one and three years. This brow-enhancing method has been generally shown to last for a lengthier time than microblading and gives a softer, more-filled in look at the same time.

This longer-lasting duration is essential to many people, since one of the reasons people go for semi-permanent eyebrow treatments is to reclaim part of the time-consuming period they spend applying their makeup daily.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_empty_space height=”80px”][vc_images_carousel images=”9708,9421,9420″ img_size=”medium”][vc_empty_space height=”80px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

What are Powdered Brows?

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Over the past few years, you may have heard about more and more people using a technique called microblading. This method is used to correct the problem of thin eyebrows. A semi-permanent solution, microblading uses a needle in a hand tool to create the appearance of eyebrow hairs that combine to give the illusion of a much fuller brow.

When you go for a microblading session, you first must decide what kind of look you are trying to achieve. Do you want just to enhance your current brow, or fill it in as much as possible? Then, you need to decide what color best matches your hair, existing eyebrows and skin tone.
Once you are ready to go, a numbing agent is applied to the skin.

This helps minimize the pain from the needle during the actual microblading. Since this is a somewhat invasive procedure, a numbing cream is indeed necessary. Your skin is also sanitized at the same time, making sure that this practice is safely done.

The next step is then the actual microblading, where small strokes mimicking eyebrow hairs are applied one by one using a handheld tool. This tool doesn’t deeply penetrate the skin; rather, it creates small scratches that transfer the semi-permanent pigment into the skin. The actual procedure generally takes between thirty and forty-five minutes.

Then, a calming cream is applied to help your face heal more quickly and more easily. After all, due to the needle, your skin is likely to experience redness, discomfort, and possibly even some scabbing. It may even be uncomfortable to sleep for a couple of days while your skin is healing from the microblading.

Now that you know what microblading is, you may be wondering how long this technique generally lasts. The answer to that is that it can range depending upon certain factors but usually lasts for a duration 2-3 years. Certain things are known to affect the staying power of microblading, such as your skin type in terms of dry versus oily, the facial products you use, sun exposure and lifestyle.

Touch-ups are to be expected once per year. If you have oily skin, the microblading will likely fade faster than other skin types. 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]

This means that those with oily skin require more frequent touch-ups.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

What is Ombre Brows?

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Ombre Brows and Powdered Brows are a semi-permanent eyebrow tattoo technique that creates a soft shaded brow look. It is recommended for all skin types and especially those who fill in their brows regularly with pencil or shadow. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”70px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_images_carousel images=”9696,9694,9697″ img_size=”medium”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

  What is the Difference between Ombre Powder Brows & Microblading? 

 

While the microblading technique uses a handheld tool to carve small cuts into the skin, the ombre powder technique uses a machine that deposits thousands of nano dots into the skin. The Ombre powder technique is less traumatic and invasive to the skin making it suitable for all skin types. 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Step by step for Microblading/Powder brows

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”80px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]

Step 1 – Consultation –

 

We will take a look at your natural eyebrow shape, as scarce as it may be, to determine where we will be tattooing, to give you a fuller look.

You should arrive with your brows made up how you normally have them, so we can see what you like.

You can bring some pictures of your desire shapes.

We will discuss how we can create your desired shape with microblading or powder brows.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/4″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”3/4″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 2 – Measurements –

 

The nest step involved using rulers to measure the positioning of your new brows,

Don’t forget! Eyebrows are not twins. They are sisters !

Everyone does not have perfect eyebrows.

 

We will make your brows as symmetrical as possible!

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 3 – Drawing –

 

Once we have agreed on the shape and overall finish you desire,

we will then draw on the eyebrows.

 

It looks too thick and strong with the drawing, but don’t worry.

It will come out super natural after wipe out the lines.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 4 – Mixing the color – 

 

Your chosen color which should match your natural tones or your eyebrow colors.

 

Microblading -the color should match your natural brow colors.

Powder brows -the color should match your eyebrow pencil colors.

 

I know you have no ideas which color you should choose!

Don’t worry, we will walk through each steps and provide you the best color and designs !

Will be mixed and agreed before we start.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/4″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”3/4″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 5 – Microblading –

 

If you are worried about pain, don’t be too concerned. We will use topical anesthetic !

 

We use  pre-numbing  and during-numbing gel.

Most our clients told us “DID NOT FEEL PAIN!”

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

They surprised how comfortable during the Procedure…You don’t need worry anything about pain ! I will make you feel comfortable during the treatment!

 

All of the microblading/Powder brow  of technique from Lucia Lash/Brow come together to transform your eyebrows into a masterpiece.

Using a microblade, ink is implanted into your skin by making microstrokes that resemble hair to give you the brows you’ve always dreamed of.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/4″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”3/4″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 6 – Time to heal will be given aftercare instructions –

 

You will be given some aftercare gel that you can put over the top to stop water getting in. Remember the skin is open like a wound, so you have to avoid getting any infection.

After 5-7 days they may start to itch as the skin is healing, which is perfectly normal – try not to touch them!

As they fade more you may well get disappointed but stay patient – it is normal for brows to go a bit lighter as part of the healing process, but then color will come back again.

Check our healing Process.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Step 7 – Touch up session –

(Your second session is included in the price)

 

You will need a second session of microblading for the full effect.

You can have this done 6-8 weeks after your first treatment.

You will discuss the results so far and decide how much more you want to add in.

The process and after care is the same as before. 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_images_carousel images=”10348,10349,10350,10351,10353,10354,10356,10357,10358,10359,10360,10362,10363,10364,10365,10366,10367,10361,10345″ img_size=”300×350″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

EYELINER 

 

Semi-permanent eyeliner is best on someone who wears makeup frequently. This will give you a perfectly placed eyeliner without you having to apply eyeliner daily ever again! 

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

(Include $200 non refundable booking fee they are not refundable for No-shows and  cancelations after 24H)

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_column_text]

(Include $200 non refundable booking fee they are not refundable for No-shows and  cancelations after 24H)

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

Lip

 

A lip tattoo is a professional procedure that involves inserting color pigments into your lips with small tattooing needles. This may come in the form of tattoo art in your lip area or perhaps permanent makeup as an aesthetic procedure called cosmetic tattooing.

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_zigzag][vc_empty_space height=”50px”][vc_column_text]

PERMANENT MAKE-UP TREATMENT/ BEFORE & AFTER CARE INSTRUCTIONS ALL PERMANENT MAKE-UP PROCEDURES ARE MULTI-SESSION PROCESSES. 

 

An initial application is incomplete until after a follow-up appointment, which should be scheduled approximately 6-8 weeks after your initial appointment. There may be an additional charge for the follow-up appointment after your initial application if it is not included in your service price. 1st follow up is recommended to be performed within 3 months of the initial application.

 Two or three applications may be required to achieve the desired results. It is not ncommon to lose up to 70% of the color on the ﬁrst application.

 

While your skin heals, be prepared for the color intensity of your procedure to be significantly larger, sharper, brighter, or darker than what is expected for the ﬁnal out come. This is a normal and expected result of the application and healing process. The healing process will take a number of days to complete, depending on how quickly the outer layer of your skin exfoliates and new skin regrows to take its place. 

 

BEFORE THE TREATMENT: 

・Do not take Asprin, Niacin, Vitamin E or IBUprofen 24 hours before the procedure 

・Do not drink coffee, alcohol or energizing drinks on the day of procedure 

・If you are use to getting your brows tinted, do at least 1 week prior to the permanent makeup procedure 

・Do not tan or sun bathe 30 days before procedure

・Do not wax 2-3 days before procedure 

・Do not have any chemical peels, dermabrasions, mesotherapy, or any other intense treatments which will cause faster skin cell rejuvenating and cause skin irritation 3-4 weeks before procedure. 

・Wash your hair before the procedure.

 

 

AFTER THE TREATMENT: 

・Do not contact with water or any other liquids than what was recommended for 10 days after the treatment. Even a small drop which seems unimportant may expand the wound and scabbing will appear . 

・Clean the area with a small amount of sterile water on a cotton pad 2-4 times a day for the ﬁrst day. This will help remove any excess lymph, blood and pigment that may appear after the procedure. 

・In case of dryness, but not earlier that the 3rd day, apply a very small amount of coconut or grape seed oil. Make sure your eyebrows are not greasy, but just moistened a little so you won’t see any residue of the oil. 

・After 10 days you may use a gentle soap or non greasy facial cleanser to keep the eyebrows clean. 

・Do not use other ointments, cream with vitamins or antibiotics on eyebrows during the healing process. 

・No sunbathing or tanning for 4 weeks. 

・No chemical peels, mesotherapy, dermabrasion, botox and any other strong treatments for 3-4 weeks. 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Pricing[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″][vc_empty_space height=”50px”]Appointment[vc_empty_space height=”50px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row kd_background_image_position=”vc_row-bg-position-top”][vc_column][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row]
